user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_default_log_handler:
```c
void metal_default_log_handler(enum metal_log_level level,
			       const char *format, ...)
{
#ifdef DEFAULT_LOGGER_ON
	char msg[1024];
	va_list args;
	static const char * const level_strs[] = {
		"metal: emergency: ",
		"metal: alert:     ",
		"metal: critical:  ",
		"metal: error:     ",
		"metal: warning:   ",
		"metal: notice:    ",
		"metal: info:      ",
		"metal: debug:     ",
	};

	va_start(args, format);
	vsnprintf(msg, sizeof(msg), format, args);
	va_end(args);

	if (level <= METAL_LOG_EMERGENCY || level > METAL_LOG_DEBUG)
		level = METAL_LOG_EMERGENCY;

	fprintf(stderr, "%s%s", level_strs[level], msg);
#else
	(void)level;
	(void)format;
#endif
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_default_log_handler:
enum metal_log_level {
	METAL_LOG_EMERGENCY,	/**< system is unusable.               */
	METAL_LOG_ALERT,	/**< action must be taken immediately. */
	METAL_LOG_CRITICAL,	/**< critical conditions.              */
	METAL_LOG_ERROR,	/**< error conditions.                 */
	METAL_LOG_WARNING,	/**< warning conditions.               */
	METAL_LOG_NOTICE,	/**< normal but significant condition. */
	METAL_LOG_INFO,		/**< informational messages.           */
	METAL_LOG_DEBUG,	/**< debug-level messages.             */
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
if (level <= METAL_LOG_EMERGENCY || level > METAL_LOG_DEBUG)
		level = METAL_LOG_EMERGENCY;
explanation:
Only modifications of function parameters are relevant for MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8. The remaining code does not modify any parameter:
- The parameter 'format' is a const char * and is only read (passed to va_start/vsnprintf); it is not assigned to.
- The variadic mechanism (va_list args, va_start, va_end) operates on a local va_list, not on a function parameter.
- 'msg' and 'level_strs' are local objects (level_strs is static const) and do not affect parameters.
- fprintf/ vsnprintf calls use the parameters but do not assign to them.
- The '#else' branch uses '(void)level;' and '(void)format;' only to suppress unused-parameter warnings; these casts do not modify the parameters.
- The enum definition is unrelated to modifying parameters.
Therefore no other fragments need investigation under Rule 17.8.
